type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":"https://www.timesnownews.com/sports/cricket/yuzvendra-chahal-breaks-lasith-malingas-record-during-ipl-2023-match-between-rr-and-pbks-article-99281660","url":"https://www.timesnownews.com/sports/cricket/yuzvendra-chahal-breaks-lasith-malingas-record-during-ipl-2023-match-between-rr-and-pbks-article-99281660","articleBody":"Rajasthan Royals star spinner Yuzvendra Chahal had a forgetful day against Punjab Kings on Wednesday during the IPL 2023 Match No. 8, which was played at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati. The 32-year-old spinner, who finished as the leading wicket-taker in the cash-rich league last year and started this year’s edition by taking four wickets for 17 runs in the opening match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, conceded 50 runs in his four-over spell against Shikhar Dhawan's side. He was taken to the cleaners by PBKS batters and was only able to take one wicket.But that one wicket he picked was enough to help him break Sri Lankan legend Lasith Malinga’s IPL record. The former Mumbai Indians pacer picked up a total of 170 wickets in 122 IPL matches as a MI player during his playing days, and by taking the wicket of Punjab’s wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma on Wednesday, Chahal leapfrogged Malinga and reached the No. 2 position in the list of highest wicket-takers in IPL history. The Indian spinner now has 171 wickets to his name from 133 matches and is only behind legendary West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo in the all-time list. The 39-year-old Bravo, who retired from the IPL last year, picked up 183 wickets in 161 matches as a Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings player.In RR’s first match of the 2023 edition, Chahal picked up four wickets, and by doing so, he became the first Indian bowler to take 300 or more wickets in T20 cricket. And in addition to that, he also broke Amit Mishra’s record of being the highest wicket-taker among Indians in IPL history. The 40-year-old Mishra, who is part of the Lucknow Super Giants set-up in the IPL this year, accounted for the dismissal of 166 batters in 154 games. He will also have a chance to leapfrog Malinga’s tally and move up in the table in the matches to During IPL 2023 Match Between RR And PBKS</h1><div class="QA-An _3PEiJ"><h2>Rajasthan Royals' star Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal picked up one wicket against Punjab Kings during Match No. 8 of IPL 2023, which was played in Guwahati on Wednesday (April 5), and by getting rid of PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma, he leapfrogged Sri Lanka and Mumbai Indians legend Lasith Malinga's tally of 170 wickets in IPL matches.</h2></div><div class="trinity-skip-it _2ndN5"><div><amp-img src="https://static.tnn.in/authorthumb/479257122.cms?width=30&height=30" width="auto" height="30" The 32-year-old spinner, who finished as the leading wicket-taker in the cash-rich league last year and started this year’s edition by taking four wickets for 17 runs in the opening match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, conceded 50 runs in his four-over spell against Shikhar Dhawan's side. He was taken to the cleaners by PBKS batters and was only able to take one wicket.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">But that one wicket he picked was enough to help him break Sri Lankan legend <a id="64162" type="General" weightage="20" keywordseo="lasith-malinga" source="Orion" href="/topic/lasith-malinga">Lasith Malinga</a>’s IPL record. The former Mumbai Indians pacer picked up a total of 170 wickets in 122 IPL matches as a MI player during his playing days, and by taking the wicket of Punjab’s wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma on Wednesday, Chahal leapfrogged Malinga and reached the No. 2 position in the list of highest wicket-takers in IPL history. The Indian spinner now has 171 wickets to his name from 133 matches and is only behind legendary West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo in the all-time list. The 39-year-old Bravo, who retired from the IPL last year, picked up 183 wickets in 161 matches as a Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings player.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div class="_3Ccg4"><div class="trinity-skip-it _1hnFO _3rhfv"><div class="aV3zW  "> <span></span><p class="_2lJpP _3PEiJ _3rhfv"></p><div><div class="fb-embded"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-theme="light" ><p lang="en" dir="ltr">𝙈𝙤𝙣𝙪𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙡! @yuzi_chahal is now the second-highest wicket-taker in the history of #TATAIPL 👏🏻👏🏻#RRvPBKS |…  <a href="https://t.co/F5Q76oW6Fn">t.co/F5Q76oW6Fn</a></p>— ANI (@ANI) <a href="https://twitter.com/ANI/status/1643691270030913538?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">Apr 6, 2023</a></blockquote></div></div></div></div></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div class="_3Ccg4"><div class="trinity-skip-it _1hnFO _3rhfv"><div class="aV3zW  "> <span></span><p class="_2lJpP _3PEiJ _3rhfv"></p><div><div class="fb-embded"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-theme="light" ><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Yuzvendra Chahal - one of the greatest of the IPL.  <a href="https://t.co/SZCUz53vED">t.co/SZCUz53vED</a></p>— ANI (@ANI) <a href="https://twitter.com/ANI/status/1643638270621020160?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">Apr 5, 2023</a></blockquote></div></div></div></div></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">In RR’s first match of the 2023 edition, Chahal picked up four wickets, and by doing so, he became the first Indian bowler to take 300 or more wickets in T20 cricket. 67,"hostid":183,"text":"Rajasthan Royals star spinner Yuzvendra Chahal had a forgetful day against Punjab Kings on Wednesday during the IPL 2023 Match No. 8, which was played at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati. The 32-year-old spinner, who finished as the leading wicket-taker in the cash-rich league last year and started this year’s edition by taking four wickets for 17 runs in the opening match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, conceded 50 runs in his four-over spell against Shikhar Dhawan's side. He was taken to the cleaners by PBKS batters and was only able to take one wicket.But that one wicket he picked was enough to help him break Sri Lankan legend Lasith Malinga’s IPL record. The former Mumbai Indians pacer picked up a total of 170 wickets in 122 IPL matches as a MI player during his playing days, and by taking the wicket of Punjab’s wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma on Wednesday, Chahal leapfrogged Malinga and reached the No. 2 position in the list of highest wicket-takers in IPL history. The Indian spinner now has 171 wickets to his name from 133 matches and is only behind legendary West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo in the all-time list. The 39-year-old Bravo, who retired from the IPL last year, picked up 183 wickets in 161 matches as a Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings player.In RR’s first match of the 2023 edition, Chahal picked up four wickets, and by doing so, he became the first Indian bowler to take 300 or more wickets in T20 cricket. And in addition to that, he also broke Amit Mishra’s record of being the highest wicket-taker among Indians in IPL history. The 40-year-old Mishra, who is part of the Lucknow Super Giants set-up in the IPL this year, accounted for the dismissal of 166 batters in 154 games. He will also have a chance to leapfrog Malinga’s tally and move up in the table in the matches to come.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Yuzvendra Chahal Breaks Lasith Malinga's Record During IPL 2023 Match Between RR And PBKS","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Cricket","titleforurl":"yuzvendra chahal breaks lasith malinga's record during ipl 2023 match between rr and pbks","synopsis":"Rajasthan Royals' star Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal picked up one wicket against Punjab Kings during Match No. 8 of IPL 2023, which was played in Guwahati on Wednesday (April 5), and by getting rid of PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma, he leapfrogged Sri Lanka and Mumbai Indians legend Lasith Malinga's tally of 170 wickets in IPL matches.","seopath":"sports\u002Fcricket\u002Fyuzvendra-chahal-breaks-lasith-malingas-record-during-ipl-2023-match-between-rr-and-pbks","thumbsize":53182,"mediatype":"webp","mediatypeval":44,"insertdate":1680746084000,"updatedate":1680746086193,"createdby":"harshit.bisht@timesgroup.com","assoc":[],"cmsassoc":[{"msid":99198061,"parentid":87846467,"hostid":183,"cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Yuzvendra Chahal Creates History, Becomes 1st Indian Bowler To Take 300 Wickets In T20 Matches","parenttitle":"Cricket","titleforurl":"yuzvendra chahal creates history, becomes 1st indian bowler to take 300 wickets in t20 matches","synopsis":"Yuzvendra Chahal created history on Sunday (April 2) during Match No. 4 of IPL 2023 that was played between the Rajasthan Royals and Sunrisers Hyderabad in Hyderabad. Rajasthan Royals (RR) and Punjab Kings (PBKS) are to lock horns on Wednesday (April 05) at 7:30 PM IST. The eighth match of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2023 will be held at Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati. Sanju Samson-led Rajasthan Royals had a great start to the 16th edition of IPL, they are coming into this match after beating Sunrisers Hyderabad by 72 runs in their opening game. The 22-year-old Karnataka-based cricketer made his IPL debut in 2020 with Royal Challengers Bangalore, and after impressing with his batting show in the first two seasons of the cash-rich league, he bagged a bumper contract in the IPL 2022 mega auction. The winners of the inaugural edition Rajasthan Royals splashed out Rs 7.75 crore to acquire his services. But the left-handed batter, who made his T20I debut for the Men in Blue in July 2021, has failed to stamp his authority in the RR set-up so far.He featured in all 17 matches for the Jaipur-based side last year and played in the first two matches of this year’s IPL as well, but has only managed to score 399 runs. This is fairly low in comparison to his first two years with RCB, where he scored 473 and 411 runs in 15 and 14 matches, respectively. One of the main reasons for Padikkal’s dip in performance could be attributed to changes in his batting position. The left-handed batter, who played as an opener for his state team and RCB in the first two seasons, comes out to bat at No. 3 or 4 for the Royals. And he has not looked comfortable at all in the middle order. In 19 innings, he has only one fifty as a middle-order batter.And taking note of Padikkal’s struggle in the middle order, IPL franchise Lucknow Super Giants posted a tweet after the batter's dismissal during IPL 2023 Match No. 8 between Rajasthan Royals and Punjab Kings and wrote, \"Padikkal bhai ki jabse opening position gayi hai tabse he unka downfall start hogya hai.\"The franchise, however, later deleted the tweet, but by then fans had already taken screenshots of it, and now it is going viral on social media platforms.The Sanju Samson-led side that reached the final of the IPL 2022 suffered a close five-run defeat against Punjab Kings on Wednesday. Keep watching to know more about it all! #breakingnews #aap #bjp #satyendarjain #mirrornow"}}]},"leadVideoAutoPlay":false},{"msid":99284920,"parentid":87846467,"hostid":183,"text":"Star Indian wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, who met with an unfortunate accident on December 30 last year in which he suffered multiple injuries, is not playing in the ongoing 2023 edition of the Indian Premier League. The 25-year-old is out of action for an indefinite period of time, and there are serious doubts over his availability for the 2023 edition of the ICC Men’s ODI World Cup as well, which will take place in October and November later this year in India.Pant, who is recovering well these days, was associated with the Delhi Capitals in the IPL and captained the side in the last two editions of the cash-rich league as well. Despite not being fit enough to play for the side on the field, Pant took the opportunity to support the team from the stands during the team’s first home game of the IPL 2023 season. Delhi played its first home game of IPL 2023 on Tuesday (April 4) against the defending champion Gujarat Titans, and in that fixture, Pant was seen cheering for the side from the stands.But it was a forgettable return for the Delhi Capitals to Arun Jaitely Stadium in the IPL after four years as they suffered a six-wicket defeat. It was the second match in a row where Delhi failed to produce the desired result.During the match, with Pant in attendance, a fan carried a poster on which she mentioned Bollywood actor Urvashi Rautela and wrote, \"Thank God Urvashi Is Not Here\". The 29-year-old actor took note of that and shared a picture of her from her Instagram handle with the caption, \"Why?\" Her post immediately went viral on the photo- and video-sharing platform, along with Twitter and Facebook.        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Urvashi Rautela (@urvashirautela) ]]\u003EPant and Rautela were in the news last year when they shared some cryptic messages for each other on social media. That generated a lot of buzz, and after all that, Uravshi was spotted in Dubai and Australia as well during India’s Asia Cup and T20 World Cup matches. She also shared a picture of her around Pant’s hospital when he was getting treatment in Mumbai.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Urvashi Rautela Reacts To Fans She's 'Not Here' Poster During DC vs GT Match With Rishabh Pant In Attendance","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Cricket","titleforurl":"urvashi rautela reacts to fans she's 'not here' poster during dc vs gt match with rishabh pant in attendance","synopsis":"Delhi Capitals skipper Rishabh Pant was in attendance during DC's first home match of IPL 2023 on Tuesday (April 4) at the Arun Jaitely Stadium. And during the match, a fan carried a poster on which she wrote, 'Thank God Urvashi is not here'. And taking note of it, the Bollywood actor shared her picture from her social media accounts and captioned it, 'Why?'.","seopath":"sports\u002Fcricket\u002Furvashi-rautela-reacts-to-fans-shes-not-here-poster-during-dc-vs-gt-match-with-rishabh-pant-in-attendance","thumbsize":44246,"mediatype":"webp","mediatypeval":44,"insertdate":1680756215000,"updatedate":1680756216817,"createdby":"harshit.bisht@timesgroup.com","assoc":[],"cmsassoc":[{"msid":99245735,"parentid":87846467,"hostid":183,"cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Rishabh Pant Makes First Public Appearence Since Car Accident; Arrives At Kotla For DC Vs GT Clash - Watch","parenttitle":"Cricket","titleforurl":"ipl 2023 - rishabh pant makes first public appearence since car accident; arrives at kotla for dc vs gt clash - watch","synopsis":"Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant, who had a horror car accident in December 2022, appeared in public for the first time, attending the ongoing 2023 Indian Premier League (IPL) match between the Delhi Capitals and Gujarat Titans at Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium. He still needs crutches to walk and was aided by officials as he greeted people before watching the game. main.articleBody: Rajasthan Royals star spinner Yuzvendra Chahal had a forgetful day against Punjab Kings on Wednesday during the IPL 2023 Match No. 8, which was played at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati. The 32-year-old spinner, who finished as the leading wicket-taker in the cash-rich league last year and started this year’s edition by taking four wickets for 17 runs in the opening match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, conceded 50 runs in his four-over spell against Shikhar Dhawan's side. He was taken to the cleaners by PBKS batters and was only able to take one wicket.But that one wicket he picked was enough to help him break Sri Lankan legend Lasith Malinga’s IPL record. The former Mumbai Indians pacer picked up a total of 170 wickets in 122 IPL matches as a MI player during his playing days, and by taking the wicket of Punjab’s wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma on Wednesday, Chahal leapfrogged Malinga and reached the No. 2 position in the list of highest wicket-takers in IPL history. The Indian spinner now has 171 wickets to his name from 133 matches and is only behind legendary West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo in the all-time list. The 39-year-old Bravo, who retired from the IPL last year, picked up 183 wickets in 161 matches as a Mumbai Indians and Chennai Super Kings player.In RR’s first match of the 2023 edition, Chahal picked up four wickets, and by doing so, he became the first Indian bowler to take 300 or more wickets in T20 cricket. And in addition to that, he also broke Amit Mishra’s record of being the highest wicket-taker among Indians in IPL history. The 40-year-old Mishra, who is part of the Lucknow Super Giants set-up in the IPL this year, accounted for the dismissal of 166 batters in 154 games. He will also have a chance to leapfrog Malinga’s tally and move up in the table in the matches to come.
main.headline: Yuzvendra Chahal Breaks Lasith Malinga's Record During IPL 2023 Match Between RR And PBKS
main.description: Rajasthan Royals' star Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal picked up one wicket against Punjab Kings during Match No. 8 of IPL 2023, which was played in Guwahati on Wednesday (April 5), and by getting rid of PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma, he leapfrogged Sri Lanka and Mumbai Indians legend Lasith Malinga's tally of 170 wickets in IPL matches.

image.caption: Yuzvendra Chahal breaks Lasith Malinga's IPL record.
